title.narrative: Improved efficiency and equity in teacher deployment

comment.narrative: 45% of teachers in the teaching cadre at the primary education level are not deployed according to schooling needs.

MoE states that as a result of addressing the teacher deployment issue through the hiring of contract teachers at primary schoolslevel, the deployment issue is being progressively resolved. However, evidence shows that teacher deployment is still a challengeat48%. The challenges in terms of teacher deployment are more fully discussed in the EFA-FTI Project Implementation CompletionReportdated June 28, 2012.

title.narrative: Regularly updated documentation used to support the development of the sector

comment.narrative: The education sector lacks relevant and up-to-date analytical studies to guide the development of the education sector strategy

Up-to-date documentation is produced and used to inform the strategy, including the following studies: - Analysis of thepost-basiceducation system - Review of the impact of the contract teachers program on the quality of education - Country StatusReport (RESEN)

The work is ongoing and likely to be completed only after project closing. Analytical work under component 1 has been started withthe recruitment of international technical expertise who are collaborating with the National Technical Team. The synthesis study onthe analytical documents in the sector is being completed and will serve asan input for the revision of the education sectorstrategy.

title.narrative: Beneficiary participation in school functioning and school accountability in 86 selected schools in the ZEP

comment.narrative: The activity has now been completed by Plan Cameroon. Note: The number of schools initially envisaged was 86. However, since 29schools were either being already rehabilitated by other development partners, or by the government through the BIP (Budgetd'investissement public), and some of the schools required significant rehabilitation since the technical evaluation revealedgreater than 50% degradation, the IDA project financed the sensitization program and rehabilitation of works in the remaining 57schools which wereassessed to have 50% or less degradation. The 50% threshold was set to ensure that sufficient funds wereavailable to carry out fulland reasonable rehabilitation of the schools.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: The contract anticipates 419 rehabilitated classrooms. However, there have been some issues with constructionscompanies/enterprises in the Eastern Region. It is therefore likely that the final number of rehabilitated classrooms could be lessthan the target number. The contracts with the community level enterprises for schools renovation were signed in April/May, and therehabilitation is now under completion. The community sensitization work has also been completed.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: A summative evaluation of student achievement/ assessment system after primary education does exist. However, there are no regularformative, qualitative assessments. Further, the early grade reading assessment results undertaken in 2011/12 have not yet beenvalidated by the Ministry of Basic Education.

The schools rehabilitation/ renovation has now been completed, the construction of latrines has commenced, and 33 out of 37 wellshave been dug. 34,883 community members through 1190 meetings in the 4 ZEP regions have benefited from the mobilization andsensitization program.Meanwhile, 113 capacity development activities have been undertaken since the original project wasimplemented, of which 32 capacity development activites/workshops have benefited 1,576 direct beneficiaries since the project wasrestructured in April2010. Further, an estimated 57,302 students in 57 schools will benefit from the schoolsrehabilitation/renovation activity. The target of 75,000 was based on an renovation and community sensitization of an estimated 86schools.
